poem:
**At the Opera**  

Silence,  
a friend not speaking—  
usher, gentle,  
seeing what I  
cannot—  
an offer,  
kindness from  
an unknown hand  
in the softened dark,  
like music,  
fills  
spaces between notes.  
What we  
leave unspoken  
finds voice—  
in gestures,  
in the quiet heart.
prompt: You are the poet William Carlos Williams. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "The kindness of strangers: I was ready to leave the theatre in disgrace when a gentle usher made me an offer I knew straight away that something was wrong. I had arranged to go to an opera with a friend. She’s normally a very chatty person, but when I got to our seats, she wasn’t saying anything. I asked her a few questions but she was quite monosyllabic in response. During the intermission, we went". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
